author: Luis A. Cruz
subject: Got my Lupin 3rd PSX game!
body:
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Thought I would try to generate a little traffic with
a review of my recent acquisition... _Lupin 3rd:  Chateau
de Cagliostro_ for the Sony Playstation.

This is a three disc set; each CD has a picture on its label
side:  one of Lupin, one of Clarisse, and one of the rest of
the normal Lupin cast.  The manual contains a brief pictorial
review of the movie itself before going into the game details.

The premise of the game sets you up as a tourist wandering
around Cagliostro learning about the exploits of Lupin.  You
have to solve "puzzles"; mostly it is a matter of finding an
item and then figuring out who to give it to next.  The background
graphics are rich and remind me a bit of Myst (though not quite as
sharp and polished).  The characters are drawn exactly as they were
or would be in the movie.  The game control is very simple and
supports
the PSX mouse.  One button selects items or interacts with people and
the environment; the other backs out of menus.

Basically, this game serves as an interactive memorial album for the
movie.  All the dialog and text is in Japanese though it hasn't slowed
me down yet; most of the "puzzles" can be solved with a little
patience.
Not sure how it manages to span 3 discs worth of play yet, but I hope
to
find out.

So, anyone else out there have an interesting piece of Lupin
merchandise
they would like to describe and make us drool over? :)  A lot of neat
stuff has been up for grabs lately on www.ebay.com.  The only Lupin
poster I have ever seen went very quickly; anyone know where to pick
up a decent Lupin poster or wall scroll?
